job_description: About the job Your Opportunity:  We are seeking an experienced and innovative individual for the role of Data Analyst, Workplace Health & Safety – Standards and Innovation. This is a unique opportunity in the Data Management & Business Planning team. The Data Analyst will develop innovative and effective approaches to provide measurement, analysis and evaluation support to the WHS Department as a whole, as well as other internal clients (e.g., senior operational leaders, unit managers, Data Integration, Management, and Reporting (DIMR), Workforce Analytics, and HR Clients Services). The analyst will work collaboratively alongside WHS Business Partnerships and the Standard & Innovation teams to discover processes with the different stakeholders to identify business requirements and expected outcomes.  Description:  The Data Analyst provides health and safety data integration, performance measurement and reporting for Alberta Health Services through the preparation of integrated performance data, interpreting trends and patterns, and providing recommendation through professional communication methods. The Analyst works with databases, spreadsheets, HR Information Systems and other analytical software packages. The Analyst is responsible for identifying solutions for typical requests (e.g., injury rates for a group of departments) and non-typical/unique problems requiring a health and safety data solution (e.g., performance metrics need to be defined for a new WHS program being implemented across AHS). The Analyst will use appropriate techniques to extract data from source information systems (e.g. writes scripts or queries to extract the right data and organize into a logical format for subsequent interpretation), and will integrate information where required. The Analyst is responsible for ensuring data quality through all integration, analysis and reporting steps, applies rules to obtain reliable results, and ensures consistent, correct use and interpretation of data. The Analyst works with multiple data types (e.g., workplace injury data, WHS program participation, WCB claims information, pay codes, costs) from multiple data sources (e.g., WCB, GWL, EFAP, HRMS, Payroll, and Finance) and are expected to integrate data across these and other complex data sources to produce meaningful data sets. The Analyst must have strong verbal and written communication skills and be able to use advanced communication skills to present the rationale of findings in relatable terms to clients. This role influences departmental direction as it provinces contextual knowledge regarding the systems and data constraints within which the team must to operate. Advanced computer skills required in Excel, Access, and Word, and SQL. Experiences in writing and testing SQL scripts as well as relational database integration with SQL. Experience in providing complex data and analytical expertise to projects and programs, to help the business clients and partners with all levels of Worker safety and WHS performance reporting. Develop databases, perform complex data queries across multiple datasets and provide sophisticated analytics and measures. Support technical elements to build and maintain data warehouse, functional metrics or baseline data for the WHS programs and projects. Produce and maintain the periodical reports for various programs, generate and develop reports in many platforms such as Tableau, MS Excel, MS Access and etc. Experience in the application of information technology, database design and information management. Ability to interact with senior leaders by presenting detailed plans, complex analyses, broad & ambiguous information and findings in businesses and user-friendly language. job_description: About the job Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.  Not ready to apply? Why Ciena  We are big proponents of life-work integration and provide the flexibility and tools to make it a reality with remote work and potentially, part-time work. We believe an inclusive, diverse and barrier-free work environment makes for empowered and committed employees. We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families and also offer a variety of paid family leave programs. We offer flexible paid time off! Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.  How You Will Contribute  Reporting to the Custom Solutions Delivery senior manager as a Network Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex telecommunications network data to support our customers in making informed decisions. You will apply machine learning techniques, data mining, statistical modeling, and create advanced data visualizations. The ideal candidate should possess a solid understanding of Python and popular data science libraries. Experience with graph databases like neo4j and visualization software such as Tableau is highly desirable. Additionally, expertise in ML/AI development and knowledge of telecommunication networks will greatly contribute to your success in this position.  You will partner with customers and other stakeholders to understand the customer’s needs, datasets, and objectives and how Ciena can best support their transformation journey.  You will develop analyses, reports, and visualizations to drive the customer outcomes.  You will work closely with colleagues of various skillsets to generate those analyses, reports, and visualizations. You will prepare technical documentation, present, and coherently relay the information to the customer.  You will provide weekly updates to varying internal and external contract stakeholders, including Ciena PM’s. From time to time, you will join customer pre-sales calls and share knowledge/expertise.   What Does Ciena Expect of You?  Initiative – you’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines. Customer first mentality – what’s important to the customer is also important to you. You make getting things done a priority. Agility – you are readily able to make key decisions and manage competing and ever-changing priorities. A commitment to ongoing learning – you have the ability to rapidly learn new, sophisticated technological concepts and apply that knowledge in your daily activities.  The Must Haves  Bachelor of Science degree in in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or similar technical field of study or experience in related field in lieu of a degree. Proven working experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst. Strong knowledge of Python and common data science libraries. Experience in data visualization and software, particularly Tableau. Experience in machine learning. Willingness and ability to travel up to 10% of the time. Must be ready to work in a very collaborative yet remote environment, with colleagues and customers in different time zones.  Assets  Knowledge and experience with databases, more specifically graph database (neo4j) is a plus. Knowledge of telecommunication networks is a plus. Knowledge and experience of internet service provider operation and planning processes is a plus. Knowledge and experience with internet service providers systems (NMS, IMS, BPMS) is a plus. Knowledge and experience with graphical data analytics software (such as Lavastorm, Data360) is a plus.  Qui est Ciena? Nous savons à quel point la sécurité financière est importante. Il ne fait aucun doute pour nous que chacun a besoin de temps pour se ressourcer. Nous offrons ainsi des congés payés illimités! À travail remarquable, récompense méritée. Nous disposons d’un excellent programme de reconnaissance, offrant des récompenses régulières et de plus importantes récompenses pour les performances exemplaires.  Ce qu’il sera attendu de vous  Sous la responsabilité du directeur principal de Custom Solutions Delivery, en tant qu’analyste de réseau, vous serez chargé(e) d’analyser et d’interpréter des données complexes sur les réseaux de télécommunications afin d’aider nos clients à prendre des décisions éclairées. Vous appliquerez des techniques d’apprentissage automatique, d’exploration de données et de modélisation statistique et vous créerez des visualisations de données avancées. La personne idéale pour ce poste doit avoir une excellente compréhension de Python et des bibliothèques de science des données les plus courantes. Une expérience des bases de données orientées graphe telles que neo4j et des logiciels de visualisation tels que Tableau est hautement souhaitable. En outre, une expertise en développement de l’apprentissage machine et de l’intelligence artificielle et une connaissance des réseaux de télécommunication contribueront grandement à votre réussite dans ce poste. De temps à autre, vous participerez aux appels d’avant-vente avec les clients et partagerez vos connaissances et votre expertise. Expérience en visualisation de données et des logiciels, en particulier Tableau. Expérience en apprentissage machine. Volonté et capacité de voyager jusqu’à 10 % du temps. Prêt(e) à travailler dans un environnement très collaboratif, mais à distance, avec des collègues et des clients situés dans des fuseaux horaires différents. job_description: About the job At AstraZeneca, we pride ourselves on crafting a collaborative culture that champions knowledge-sharing, ambitious thinking and innovation – ultimately providing employees with the opportunity to work across teams, functions and even the globe.  Recognizing the importance of individualized flexibility, our ways of working allow employees to balance personal and work commitments while ensuring we continue to create a strong culture of collaboration and teamwork by engaging face-to-face in our offices 3 days a week.  Our dedication to sustainability is also central to our culture and part of what makes AstraZeneca a great place to work. We know the health of people, the planet and our business are interconnected which is why we’re taking ambitious action to tackle some of the biggest challenges of our time, from climate change to access to healthcare and disease prevention.  AstraZeneca is a global, BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. Join the team unlocking the power of what science can do. We are working towards treating, preventing, modifying and even curing some of the world’s most complex diseases. Here we have the potential to grow our pipeline and positively impact the lives of billions of patients around the world.  We work on some of the most complex and interesting challenges. A fast-paced and agile team, we are empowered and trusted to innovate and experiment. With access to our extensive capabilities and comprehensive pipeline, you’ll be involved in countless submissions and a wide range of engaging projects along the complete drug development process.  You will join a global, diverse and cross-functional environment where you will get personal and professional development.  We are recruiting a Senior Statistician to join our growing Statistical Innovation team. Our main focus is providing statistical methodology support for all phases of clinical development for AZ’s Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism, Respiratory & Immunology, and Vaccine and Immune Therapies divisions together with specific targeted support for the Oncology division and the Rare Disease unit of AZ.  In this role, you will be a member of the Statistical Innovation team, where our data-centric focus helps us work efficiently and creatively to bring the right medicines to the right patients.  Main Duties And Responsibilities  Joining a team of statistical methodology experts, you will provide key input as you work to find solutions to problems at critical stages in the drug development cycle.
